unnormalised: **What are some must-have exam prep apps for cracking competitive exams in India?**
normalised: What are some must-have exam prep apps for cracking competitive exams in India?

unnormalised: Okay, so you're gearing up for the IIT-JEE or maybe CAT, or even something like the UPSC CSE? Dude, you're not alone! Exam prep apps are lifesavers these days. Forget lugging around those heavy books like in my dad's time!
normalised: Okay, so you are gearing up for the I I T hyphen J E E or maybe C A T, or even something like the U P S C C S E? Dude, you are not alone! Exam prep apps are lifesavers these days. Forget lugging around those heavy books like in my dad's time!

unnormalised: For starters, Unacademy is pretty solid. They have everything from live classes to mock tests. I used it for a bit back in 2020 when I was trying for NEET. You can find some amazing educators on there, like that Sharma Sir from Kota.
normalised: For starters, Unacademy is pretty solid. They have everything from live classes to mock tests. I used it for a bit back in two thousand and twenty when I was trying for N E E T. You can find some amazing educators on there, like that Sharma Sir from Kota.

unnormalised: Then there's Testbook. Their test series are seriously realistic and they have a ton of content. Plus, it's comparatively cheaper, which is always a win, especially if you're studying on a budget and your parents are already stressed about the costs, ha! Remember that pressure cooker situation before the Boards in 2015? Testbook would've helped back then.
normalised: Then there is Testbook. Their test series are seriously realistic and they have a ton of content. Plus, it is comparatively cheaper, which is always a win, especially if you are studying on a budget and your parents are already stressed about the costs, ha! Remember that pressure cooker situation before the Boards in two thousand and fifteen? Testbook would have helped back then.

unnormalised: Also, BYJU'S is quite popular. Though it might be a bit pricey, the personalized learning experience is a big plus. But honestly, shop around! Different apps work for different people. Find one that suits your learning style. And remember to set realistic study goals! Maybe try studying from 09:00 hrs to 12:00 hrs and then again after your chai break? Good luck, you got this! Aim to score well before 25/12/2024.
